oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Quantum Complexity of Testing Group Commutativity
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Magniez, Frederic
Nayak, Ashwin
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Quantum Physics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We consider the problem of testing the commutativity of a black-box group specified by its k generators. The complexity (in terms of k) of this problem was first considered by Pak, who gave a randomized algorithm involving O(k) group operations. We construct a quite optimal quantum algorithm for this problem whose complexity is in O (k^{2/3}). The algorithm uses and highlights the power of the quantization method of Szegedy. For the lower bound of Omega(k^{2/3}), we give a reduction from a special case of Element Distinctness to our problem. Along the way, we prove the optimality of the algorithm of Pak for the randomized model.
Comment: 10 pages, requires fullpage,amsthm,amsfonts,amsmath; To appear in Algorithmica; earlier version appeared in ICALP 2005; corrects minor typos, results are unchanged
